page.title: 18The "low fares" debate
page.content: South Yorkshire Transport and East Midland Motor Services provide bus services in this area. The fares in South Yorkshire differ greatly from those charged in Derbyshire. Halfway to Sheffield (8 miles) costs 15p. Halfway to Eckington (3 miles) costs 28p. The reason for this is S.Y.T.'s low fares policy. Throughout 1985 there has been a strong public debate about this policy which results from subsidies from South Yorkshire County Council. Central government legislation is presently being prepared to alter this and those who support the county council have quoted possible fare increases of 500%. Others who do not use buses regularly object to their rates being used to subsidise those who do.
